snippet: The Federal Reserve said its purchase of $85 billion a month in securities would continue, citing the weak pace of growth during the first half of the year.
abstract: Federal Reserve says its purchase of $85 billion a month in securities will continue for at least another month, citing weak growth during first half of 2013; leaves its economic outlook  unchanged, suggesting it still intends to reduce volume of bond purchases later in year.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve said its purchase of $85 billion a month in securities would continue, citing the weak pace of growth during the first half of the year.

headline.main: Bond Purchases by Fed Will Continue, at Least for Another Month
headline.print_headline: Bond Purchases by Fed Will Continue, at Least For Another Month
